etymologies: Middle English (in the sense ‘distant from the correct path’): from an Anglo-Norman French variant of Old French estraie, past participle of estraier, based on Latin extra ‘out of bounds’ + vagari ‘wander’

definitions: away from the correct path or direction

examples.text: we went astray but a man redirected us

shortDefinitions: away from correct path or direction

definitions: into error or morally questionable behavior

examples.text: he was led astray by boozy colleagues

shortDefinitions: into error or morally questionable behaviour

synonyms.text: away from the straight and narrow
away from the path of righteousness
